It is located on both sides of the Wisłok River in the heartland of the Sandomierz Basin. Rzeszów has been the capital of the Subcarpathian Voivodeship (province) since 1 January 1999
column5: and is also the seat of Rzeszów County.

column1: The history of Rzeszów begins in 1354
column2: when it received city rights and privileges by Casimir III the Great. Local trade routes connecting the European Continent with the Middle East and the Ottoman Empire resulted in the city's early prosperity and development. In the 16th century
column3: Rzeszów had a connection with Gdańsk and the Baltic Sea. It also experienced growth in commerce and craftsmanship
column4: especially under local rulers and noblemen. Following the Partitions of Poland
column5: Rzeszów was annexed by the Austrian Empire and did not regain its position until it returned to Poland after World War I.

column1: Rzeszów lies in the north temperate zone and has a continental climate with four distinct seasons. It is characterised by a significant variation between hot summers and cold
column2: snowy winters. Average temperatures in summer range from 18 to 19.6 °C (64 to 67 °F) and in winter from −2.1 to 0 °C (28 to 32 °F). The average annual temperature is 8.9 °C (48 °F). In summer temperatures often exceed 25 °C (77 °F)
column3: and sometimes even 30 °C (86 °F)
column4: while winter drops to −5 °C (23 °F) at night and about 0 °C (32 °F) at day; during very cold nights the temperature drops to −15 °C (5 °F). In view of the fact that Rzeszów lies near the Carpathian Mountains
column5: there is sometimes a halny – a föhn wind
column6: when the temperature can rise rapidly.
